events.name: An Introduction to the Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
In this first meeting, we'll start exploring the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). We'll discuss the history behind GCP, and review what are the equivalent services between GCP and other cloud providers, such as AWS.

All levels of expertise are welcome, from newbies to seasoned practitioners. Just make sure you bring an inquisitive mind, and a will to learn!
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the CIC (six floor), then find the Otzaretta room.

events.name: Developing with App Engine
events.description:
In this second meeting, we'll focus on GCP App Engine. We will discuss in general the concept behind it, and discuss the differences between the standard and the flexible environments. Then, we are going to get our hands dirty with a code lab on App Engine standard environment, so make sure you bring your laptop, and that you already have a GCP account!

Also, remember we will be giving away two copies of the book Data Science on the Google Cloud Platform (http://shop.oreilly.com/product/0636920057628.do). Another good reason to attend! ;)

All levels of expertise are welcome, from newbies to seasoned practitioners. Just make sure you bring an inquisitive mind, and a will to learn!

events.name: Next '18 Extended Miami
events.description:
We are hosting a Next' 18 Extended event here in Miami, to review some of the key announcements of the main event to be held in San Francisco, July 24-27 (https://cloud.withgoogle.com/next18).

Agenda:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/18aU1EIBAg-UalVI7RAyEUfOzTVqha0XLGSPByyoCe-c/edit#heading=h.hnploacluehm

Please note that in the afternoon there is a hands-on code lab included. If you plan to attend, please bring your laptop!

See you all this Saturday!

events.name: Running a ML Model on GCP using AppEngine Flexible and Cloud Endpoints
events.description:
In this meetup, we'll walk you through deploying a custom ML model using AppEngine, and exposing using a REST API it via Cloud Endpoints.

Also, join us for a little end of year celebration! Food and beverages will be provided.

Please notice that we are meeting this time at Google Miami (Brickell). Registration will start at 5:30pm, so make sure you allocate get enough time to get downtown.

events.name: Let's talk Cloud! Axing the Skill Gap
events.description:
Let's kick off 2019 early, with our first meetup of the new year! We will be talking infrastructure, cloud, and what tools do you need to thrive on the cloud.

Please note that we'll be hosting this meetup at itopia offices, in Wynwood.

All levels of expertise are welcome, from newbies to seasoned practitioners. Just make sure you bring an inquisitive mind, and a will to learn!

events.name: The beauty to be women in technology, session 1.
events.description:
Hi everyone,

Let's kick 2019 off with our first meetup of the year, in which we will meet together and we'll talk about the skills you need to succeed when working in tech and know more about the Women Teckmakers program.

The venue will be a Starbucks. This will be a series of frequently smaller meetup that takes place around the city in a Starbucks as the venue. In this way, we can go nearby you in case that you are far away, from downtown Miami. Please feel free to post your comments or email me.

Please note that the meetup will be Wednesday 16th, @Starbuck (12000 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33181).

Looking forward to a great year and many many more meetups!

GDG Cloud Miami and Women Teckmakers Miami

events.name: The beauty to be women in technology, session 2.
events.description:
Details
Hi everyone,

We would like to meet together to keep talking about us, our goals and fears in this year 2019, as women in tech.
Join us to know more about the Women Techmakers programs and about Google Developer Group community.

Please do your RSVP the venue only has 15 spots available. Don't forget to bring a photo ID with you, this will be required for the desk registration table at the front desk.

Can't wait to see everyone.

Please feel free to post your comments or email us.

Please note that the meetup will be Wednesday 30th, @WeWork (WeWork 429 Lenox Ave (Room 1E) ).

Looking forward to a great meetup!

GDG Cloud Miami & Women Techmakers

events.name: DevFest Miami
events.description:
DevFests are community-led, developer events hosted by GDG chapters around the globe focused on community building and learning about Googleâ€™s technologies. Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it.

This is the agenda for the event:

Main Track
---------------
08:30 - 09:30 ----- Breakfast & Icebreakers
09:30 - 10:00 ----- Keynote
10:00 - 10:30 ------ Google Cloud Certifications
10:30 - 11:00 ------- Using the Cloud Speech-to-Text API
11:00 - 11:45 -------- Intro to Flutter
11:45 - 12:30 -------- Android On-Demand
12:30 - 13:00 ------- Lunch & Icebreakers
13:00 - 14:30 ------- Google Cloud Certification Codelab
14:30 - 15:00 ------- Raffle and Closing Remarks

Computer Lab
-------------------
11:00 - 12:30 -------- IoT Workshop. Lighting it up with Arduino! *
12:30 - 13:00 ------- Lunch & Icebreakers
13:00 - 14:30 ------- Flutter Codelab

*For the IoT workshop, if you were able to bring your own Arduino it would be great since we will be providing some motherboards but we have a limited number.

events.name: IWD'19 - International Women Day
events.description:
International Women's Day IWD is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of the celebration ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women's economic, political and social achievements. We are glad to announce that Miami will be celebrating the IWD, on March 27th.

Please be aware that the spot is limited please do your RSVP.

group_profile.intro: I am a Google Certified Cloud Architect, and Google Certified Data Engineer.
